column4: So I somehow locked myself out of my desktop folder.  I try to go in it and it says access denied
did you take off execute permissions on it?
sudo chmod
What do i chmod it to?
chmod O+RWX file/folder name
will add read write and execute to anybody who isn't in the listed group or owner
what did you type exactly?
you just want everyone to read and write, right?
what does ls -l say about the folder?
still there?
crash course in unix perms :)
only the most specific permissions apply, so if you say owner=read, group=read, other=read/write, the owner and the group can only read, but anyone else can read and write
are you on command line or would you prefer via nautilus?
Would you mind if you send me messages so I wont have to go through the entire chatroom log to find this again?
oops, sorry, I meant to :p
is your nick registered?
ntfs?
Yes it's ntfs
sudo mount /device/path /mount/path -t ntfs should work, but it's not permanent
captive-ntfs?
do you have a copy of ntoskn or whatever and ntfs.dll or whatever around?
reading ntfs is easy;  writing to it is hard, because writing is inherently dangerous when the people who wrote the original don't like you
but yes, it'd be nice if hd's could just be mounted in media automatically
